conclusion: To determine when objects A and B are farthest apart, analyze their velocity-time graphs and find when the distance between them is maximized.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of each object as a function of time, and the area under each curve represents the displacement of the object.
At any given time, the distance between the two objects is the difference between their displacements.
To find when the distance is maximized, compare the areas under the curves of A and B.
The point where the two velocity curves intersect, \( t_2 \), indicates when the velocities are equal.
Before \( t_2 \), object B is moving slower than object A.
After \( t_2 \), object B is moving faster than object A.
Before \( t_2 \), object A is moving faster than object B, so the distance between them increases.
At \( t_2 \), their velocities are equal, and the distance between them is at its maximum because before this point, A was increasing the gap, and after this point, B starts to close the gap.
The maximum distance between the two objects occurs at time \( t_2 \).
